summary: The Byzantine Empire, also known as the Eastern Roman Empire, lasted from Late Antiquity to the Middle Ages. It was centered in Constantinople and was a powerful force in the Mediterranean. The empire survived while the Western Roman Empire fell, and it was known as the Roman Empire by its citizens. It had a rich cultural mix of Greek and Latin influences. Over time, it faced declines and recoveries, with significant rule by Justinian I and later Muslim conquests. The empire ended with the Ottoman Empire's conquest of Constantinople in 1453.
title: Byzantine Empire
